title: Uganda declares end to latest Ebola outbreak

title: How technocracy has become our reality
snippets: Do technocrats pose a threat to democracy?
titles: How technocracy has become our reality
constructiveness_reason: This story provides a deep understanding of the rise of technocracy, offering readers actionable insights.
summary: The question of whether technocrats pose a threat to democracy is a topic of debate. Technocrats, experts in their fields who may hold significant power in policymaking, are argued by some to undermine democratic processes by prioritizing technical solutions over public opinion and democratic debate. Others contend that technocrats can enhance democracy by providing the necessary expertise to solve complex problems that elected officials may not be equipped to address. title: At least 11 killed in suspected RSF drone attack on Sudan displacement camp
snippets: Local governor says the attack knocked out a nearby power station for the fourth time since the war began two years ago.

title: DR Congo and Rwanda vow to agree peace plan within days
snippets: The two neighbouring nations sign a US-brokered deal aimed at stopping the fighting in eastern DR Congo.
titles: DR Congo and Rwanda vow to agree peace plan within days
constructiveness_reason: This story clearly highlights progress towards peace between two countries, providing useful information for readers.
summary: Two neighboring countries have signed a deal facilitated by the United States, aiming to cease hostilities in the eastern Democratic Republic of Congo. This agreement represents a diplomatic effort to bring an end to the conflict in the region.

title: Have scientists discovered a new colour called ‘olo’?
snippets: Described as a 'deeply saturated teal' colour, humans can only see it with the help of laser technology.
titles: Have scientists discovered a new colour called ‘olo’?
constructiveness_reason: This story provides basic awareness about a scientific discovery, but it doesn't provide much depth or insight.
summary: A new color described as 'deeply saturated teal' has been identified, visible to humans only through the use of laser technology. This advancement underscores the limitations of human vision and the role of technology in expanding our perception of color.

title: Drake Relays: Former Treynor prep Kulesa helps Iowa Western claim NJCAA record
snippets: The Reivers ran 11:53.10 to erase rival Iowa Central Community College's mark of 11:53.89 from 2018.
titles: Drake Relays: Former Treynor prep Kulesa helps Iowa Western claim NJCAA record
summary: The Reivers set a new record in the 4x800 meter relay with a time of 11:53.10, surpassing the previous record of 11:53.89 held by Iowa Central Community College since 2018.

title: Kremlin claims Ukraine pushed out of Kursk as Trump criticises Putin

summary: Russia has officially acknowledged for the first time the presence of North Korean troops on the ground. This marks a significant development, as it is the first official confirmation of North Korean military involvement. The details regarding the capacity or purpose of the troops' presence were not disclosed.

title: Republicans plan to scrap US audit regulator

titles: Republicans plan to scrap US audit regulator
summary: A proposal has been made to integrate the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board (PCAOB) into the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC). This move aligns with Donald Trump's broader agenda to reduce regulatory burdens.

title: DeepMind UK staff seek to unionise and challenge defence deals and Israel links
snippets: Move by employees at Google’s AI arm follows discontent after weapons and surveillance pledge is dropped
titles: DeepMind UK staff seek to unionise and challenge defence deals and Israel links
summary: Employees at Google's AI division have expressed dissatisfaction and taken action following the company's decision to abandon a pledge against working on weapons and surveillance projects. This move reflects growing concerns among staff about the ethical implications of their work and the direction of the company's policies in these areas.

title: What To Expect From Wednesday's Report On Economic Growth
snippets:
Key Takeaways

  • The U.S. GDP is expected to have grown at an annual rate of just 0.3% in the first quarter, a sharp slowdown from 2.4% in the previous quarter.
  • If it materializes, the slowdown would likely reflect the impact of a surge of imports: People raced to buy things ahead of President Donald Trump's tariffs, and imports count against GDP growth.
  • The slowdown would be one of the first "hard data" indicators showing the tariffs' economic impact.


President Donald Trump's tariffs have been slow to affect hard economic data, but that could change Wednesday when the import taxes could blow a hole in the Gross Domestic Product figures.

Wednesday's scheduled GDP report is likely to show that the key measure of the country's economic output rose at an annual rate of just 0.4% in the first quarter, according to the median forecast from a survey of economists conducted by the Wall Street Journal and Dow Jones Newswires. That would be down from 2.4% in the last quarter of 2024 and the slowest growth since 2022.

Economists said the sharp slowdown in growth will likely reflect the impact of a surge of imports: People raced to buy things from overseas before President Donald Trump's tariffs took effect, and imports subtract from the GDP.

Some forecasters think the drop will be even more drastic than the consensus and expect the economy to shrink for the first time since 2022. The Federal Reserve Bank of Atlanta's GDP Now tool, which calculates the GDP based on economic data as it is published, showed the GDP shrinking at a 2.5% annual rate in the first quarter.

The GDP report would be one of the first "hard data" indicators to show the impact of Trump's slew of tariffs against U.S. trading partners, which began in February and reached a fever pitch in April. Surveys have shown businesses and individuals growing pessimistic about the economy due to the tariffs, but key economic indicators, including unemployment and inflation, have stayed resilient thus far.
titles: What To Expect From Wednesday's Report On Economic Growth
summary: The U.S. GDP growth is anticipated to have significantly slowed to an annual rate of 0.3% in the first quarter of 2025, down from 2.4% in the previous quarter, according to forecasts. This slowdown is attributed to a surge in imports as consumers rushed to purchase goods ahead of President Donald Trump's tariffs, which negatively impact GDP growth. This expected decline would mark one of the first tangible indicators of the tariffs' economic effects. Some economists predict the economy could even shrink for the first time since 2022, with the Federal Reserve Bank of Atlanta estimating a contra

title: US government defunds research on misinformation
snippets: The US National Science Foundation cancelled funding for research on misinformation, disinformation and AI-generated deepfakes, even as misleading information runs rampant on social media
titles: US government defunds research on misinformation
summary: The US National Science Foundation has halted funding for projects focused on researching misinformation, disinformation, and AI-generated deepfakes, despite the widespread presence of misleading information on social media platforms.

title: Are 'zombie' skin cells harmful or helpful? The answer may be in their shapes
snippets: Researchers have identified three subtypes of senescent skin cells with distinct shapes, biomarkers, and functions -- an advance that could equip scientists with the ability to target and kill the harmful types while leaving the helpful ones intact.
titles: Are 'zombie' skin cells harmful or helpful? The answer may be in their shapes
summary: Researchers have discovered three distinct subtypes of senescent skin cells, each with unique shapes, biomarkers, and functions. This breakthrough could enable scientists to selectively target and eliminate harmful senescent cells, preserving those that are beneficial. This advancement holds potential for improving skin health and combating aging.
